shortdesc.ph: Sets the raw audio data format after audio mixing of captured and playback audio.
Sets the raw audio data format after audio capture and playback mixing.
Sets the format of the raw audio data after audio mixing for capture and playback.
Sets the raw audio data format after mixing the captured and playback audio.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setMixedAudioFrameParameters( {required int sampleRate, required int channel, required int samplesPerCall});
public abstract int SetMixedAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, int samplesPerCall);

section.p: The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
You must call this method before joining a channel.
You need to call this method before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: Sampling rate (Hz) of the audio data. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

Number of audio channels. Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Number of audio samples, typically 1024 in scenarios like CDN streaming.
The sample rate (Hz) of the audio data, can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels, can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The number of audio samples, typically 1024 in scenarios like CDN streaming.
The sample rate (Hz) of the audio data. You can set it to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels. You can set it to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The number of audio samples per call. Typically 1024 in scenarios like RTMP streaming.
The sampling rate (Hz) of the audio data. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of channels of the audio data. Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The number of audio samples. Typically 1024 in RTMP streaming scenarios.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: This method returns no value if the call succeeds. If the method call fails, it throws an , which you need to catch and handle. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggested solutions.
